info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:43PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Granite County through 630 PM MDT... At 542 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Philipsburg, or 23 miles northwest of Anaconda, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philipsburg, Princeton and Maxville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
